Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Deep and narrow jar with a prominent shoulder, small neck, thick lip and rounded conical base. This dark pink jar does not have a slip. The upper part of the body, which has been but simply polished, bears a horizontal rilling in the topmost section, caused by the lifting process on the potter's wheel. The lower section bears vertical grooves, caused by the appliance of the polish.  A design that could be a potter's mark can be seen half-way up the uneven surface of the body.
